013package org.apache.juneau.collections;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConsumerUtils.*;
017
018import java.io.*;
019import java.lang.reflect.*;
020import java.util.*;
021import java.util.function.*;
022
023import org.apache.juneau.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.json.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.marshaller.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.objecttools.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.parser.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.serializer.*;
031import org.apache.juneau.swap.*;
032
033/**
034 * Java implementation of a JSON object.
035 *
036 * <p>
037 * An extension of {@link LinkedHashMap}, so all methods available in that class are also available to this class.
038 *
039 * <p>
040 * Note that the use of this class is optional for generating JSON. The serializers will accept any objects that implement the
041 * {@link java.util.Map} interface.  But this class provides some useful additional functionality when working with
042 * JSON models constructed from Java Collections Framework objects.  For example, a constructor is provided for
043 * converting a JSON object string directly into a {@link Map}.  It also contains accessor methods for to avoid common
044 * typecasting when accessing elements in a list.
045 *
046 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
047 * <p class='bjava'>
048 *    <jc>// Construct an empty Map</jc>
049 *    JsonMap <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>();
050 *
051 *    <jc>// Construct a Map from JSON</jc>
052 *    <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>ofJson</jsm>(<js>"{a:'A',b:{c:'C',d:123}}"</js>);
053 *
054 *    <jc>// Construct a Map using the append method</jc>
055 *    <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>().a(<js>"foo"</js>,<js>"x"</js>).a(<js>"bar"</js>,123).a(<js>"baz"</js>,<jk>true</jk>);
056 *
057 *    <jc>// Construct a Map from XML generated by XmlSerializer</jc>
058 *    String <jv>xml</jv> = <js>"&lt;object&gt;&lt;a type='string'&gt;A&lt;/a&gt;&lt;b type='object'&gt;&lt;c type='string'&gt;C&lt;/c&gt;&lt;d type='number'&gt;123&lt;/d&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/object&gt;"</js>;
059 *    <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>(<jv>xml</jv>, XmlParser.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>);
060 *
061 *    <jc>// Construct a Map from a URL GET parameter string generated by UrlEncodingParser</jc>
062 *    String <jv>urlParams</jv> = <js>"?a='A'&amp;b={c:'C',d:123}"</js>;
063 *    <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>(<jv>urlParams</jv>, UrlEncodingParser.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>);
064 *
065 *    <jc>// Construct JSON from JsonMap</jc>
066 *    <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>ofJson</jsm>(<js>"{foo:'bar'},{baz:[123,true]}"</js>);
067 *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.toString();  <jc>// Produces "{foo:'bar'},{baz:[123,true]}"</jc>
068 *    <jv>json</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.toString(JsonSerializer.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>);  <jc>// Equivalent</jc>
069 *    <jv>json</jv> = JsonSerializer.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.serialize(<jv>map</jv>);  <jc>// Equivalent</jc>
070 *
071 *    <jc>// Get a map entry as an Integer</jc>
072 *    <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>ofJson</jsm>(<js>"{foo:123}"</js>);
073 *    Integer <jv>integer</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.getInt(<js>"foo"</js>);
074 *    <jv>integer</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.get(Integer.<jk>class</jk>, <js>"foo"</js>);  <jc>// Equivalent</jc>
075 *
076 *    <jc>// Get a map entry as a Float</jc>
077 *    <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>ofJson</jsm>(<js>"{foo:123}"</js>);
078 *    Float <jv>_float</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.getFloat(<js>"foo"</js>);
079 *    <jv>_float</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.get(Float.<jk>class</jk>, <js>"foo"</js>);  <jc>// Equivalent</jc>
080 *
081 *    <jc>// Same as above, except converted to a String</jc>
082 *    <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>ofJson</jsm>(<js>"{foo:123}"</js>);
083 *    String <jv>string</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.getString(<js>"foo"</js>); <jc>// Returns "123"</jc>
084 *    <jv>string</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.get(String.<jk>class</jk>, <js>"foo"</js>);  <jc>// Equivalent</jc>
085 *
086 *    <jc>// Get one of the entries in the list as a bean (converted to a bean if it isn't already one)</jc>
087 *    <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>ofJson</jsm>(<js>"{person:{name:'John Smith',age:45}}"</js>);
088 *    Person <jv>person</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.get(Person.<jk>class</jk>, <js>"person"</js>);
089 *
090 *    <jc>// Add an inner map</jc>
091 *    JsonMap <jv>map1</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>ofJson</jsm>(<js>"{a:1}"</js>);
092 *    JsonMap <jv>map2</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>ofJson</jsm>(<js>"{b:2}"</js>).setInner(<jv>map1</jv>);
093 *    <jk>int</jk> <jv>_int</jv> = <jv>map2</jv>.getInt(<js>"a"</js>);  <jc>// a == 1 </jc>
094 * </p>
095 *
096 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
097 *    <li class='warn'>This class is not thread safe.
098 * </ul>
099 */
100public class JsonMap extends LinkedHashMap<String,Object> {
101
102   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
103   // Static
104   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
105
106   private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
107
108   /**
109    * An empty read-only JsonMap.
110    *
111    * @serial exclude
112    */
113   public static final JsonMap EMPTY_MAP = new JsonMap() {
114
115      private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
116
117      @Override /* Map */
118      public Set<Map.Entry<String,Object>> entrySet() {
119         return Collections.<String,Object>emptyMap().entrySet();
120      }
121
122      @Override /* Map */
123      public Set<String> keySet() {
124         return Collections.<String,Object>emptyMap().keySet();
125      }
126
127      @Override /* Map */
128      public Object put(String key, Object value) {
129         throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Not supported on read-only object.");
130      }
131
132      @Override /* Map */
133      public Object remove(Object key) {
134         throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Not supported on read-only object.");
135      }
136
137      @Override /* Map */
138      public Collection<Object> values() {
139         return Collections.emptyMap().values();
140      }
141   };
142
143   /**
144    * Construct an empty map.
145    *
146    * @return An empty map.
147    */
148   public static JsonMap create() {
149      return new JsonMap();
150   }
151
152   /**
153    * Construct an empty map.
154    *
155    * @return An empty map.
156    */
157   public static JsonMap filteredMap() {
158      return create().filtered();
159   }
160
161   /**
162    * Construct a map initialized with the specified map.
163    *
164    * @param values
165    *    The map to copy.
166    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
167    *    <br>Keys will be converted to strings using {@link Object#toString()}.
168    * @return A new map or <jk>null</jk> if the map was <jk>null</jk>.
169    */
170   public static JsonMap of(Map<?,?> values) {
171      return values == null ? null : new JsonMap(values);
172   }
173
174   /**
175    * Construct a map initialized with the specified JSON string.
176    *
177    * @param json
178    *    The JSON text to parse.
179    *    <br>Can be normal or simplified JSON.
180    * @return A new map or <jk>null</jk> if the string was null.
181    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
182    */
183   public static JsonMap ofJson(CharSequence json) throws ParseException {
184      return json == null ? null : new JsonMap(json);
185   }
186
187   /**
188    * Construct a map initialized with the specified string.
189    *
190    * @param in
191    *    The input being parsed.
192    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
193    * @param p
194    *    The parser to use to parse the input.
195    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, uses {@link JsonParser}.
196    * @return A new map or <jk>null</jk> if the input was <jk>null</jk>.
197    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
198    */
199   public static JsonMap ofText(CharSequence in, Parser p) throws ParseException {
200      return in == null ? null : new JsonMap(in, p);
201   }
202
203   /**
204    * Construct a map initialized with the specified reader containing JSON.
205    *
206    * @param json
207    *    The reader containing JSON text to parse.
208    *    <br>Can contain normal or simplified JSON.
209    * @return A new map or <jk>null</jk> if the input was <jk>null</jk>.
210    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
211    */
212   public static JsonMap ofJson(Reader json) throws ParseException {
213      return json == null ? null : new JsonMap(json);
214   }
215
216   /**
217    * Construct a map initialized with the specified string.
218    *
219    * @param in
220    *    The reader containing the input being parsed.
221    *    <br>Can contain normal or simplified JSON.
222    * @param p
223    *    The parser to use to parse the input.
224    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, uses {@link JsonParser}.
225    * @return A new map or <jk>null</jk> if the input was <jk>null</jk>.
226    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
227    */
228   public static JsonMap ofText(Reader in, Parser p) throws ParseException {
229      return in == null ? null : new JsonMap(in);
230   }
231
232   /**
233    * Construct a map initialized with the specified key/value pairs.
234    *
235    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
236    * <p class='bjava'>
237    *    JsonMap <jv>map</jv> = <jk>new</jk> JsonMap(<js>"key1"</js>,<js>"val1"</js>,<js>"key2"</js>,<js>"val2"</js>);
238    * </p>
239    *
240    * @param keyValuePairs A list of key/value pairs to add to this map.
241    * @return A new map, never <jk>null</jk>.
242    */
243   public static JsonMap of(Object... keyValuePairs) {
244      return new JsonMap(keyValuePairs);
245   }
246
247   /**
248    * Construct a map initialized with the specified key/value pairs.
249    *
250    * <p>
251    * Same as {@link #of(Object...)} but calls {@link #filtered()} on the created map.
252    *
253    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
254    * <p class='bjava'>
255    *    JsonMap <jv>map</jv> = <jk>new</jk> JsonMap(<js>"key1"</js>,<js>"val1"</js>,<js>"key2"</js>,<js>"val2"</js>);
256    * </p>
257    *
258    * @param keyValuePairs A list of key/value pairs to add to this map.
259    * @return A new map, never <jk>null</jk>.
260    */
261   public static JsonMap filteredMap(Object... keyValuePairs) {
262      return new JsonMap(keyValuePairs).filtered();
263   }
264
265   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
266   // Instance
267   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
268
269   private transient BeanSession session;
270   private Map<String,Object> inner;
271   private transient ObjectRest objectRest;
272   private transient Predicate<Object> valueFilter = x -> true;
273
274   /**
275    * Construct an empty map.
276    */
277   public JsonMap() {}
278
279   /**
280    * Construct an empty map with the specified bean context.
281    *
282    * @param session The bean session to use for creating beans.
283    */
284   public JsonMap(BeanSession session) {
285      this.session = session;
286   }
287
288   /**
289    * Construct a map initialized with the specified map.
290    *
291    * @param in
292    *    The map to copy.
293    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
294    *    <br>Keys will be converted to strings using {@link Object#toString()}.
295    */
296   public JsonMap(Map<?,?> in) {
297      this();
298      if (in != null)
299         in.forEach((k,v) -> put(k.toString(), v));
300   }
301
302   /**
303    * Construct a map initialized with the specified JSON.
304    *
305    * @param json
306    *    The JSON text to parse.
307    *    <br>Can be normal or simplified JSON.
308    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
309    */
310   public JsonMap(CharSequence json) throws ParseException {
311      this(json, JsonParser.DEFAULT);
312   }
313
314   /**
315    * Construct a map initialized with the specified string.
316    *
317    * @param in
318    *    The input being parsed.
319    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
320    * @param p
321    *    The parser to use to parse the input.
322    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, uses {@link JsonParser}.
323    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
324    */
325   public JsonMap(CharSequence in, Parser p) throws ParseException {
326      this(p == null ? BeanContext.DEFAULT_SESSION : p.getBeanContext().getSession());
327      if (p == null)
328         p = JsonParser.DEFAULT;
329      if (! Utils.isEmpty(in))
330         p.parseIntoMap(in, this, bs().string(), bs().object());
331   }
332
333   /**
334    * Construct a map initialized with the specified reader containing JSON.
335    *
336    * @param json
337    *    The reader containing JSON text to parse.
338    *    <br>Can contain normal or simplified JSON.
339    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
340    */
341   public JsonMap(Reader json) throws ParseException {
342      parse(json, JsonParser.DEFAULT);
343   }
344
345   /**
346    * Construct a map initialized with the specified string.
347    *
348    * @param in
349    *    The reader containing the input being parsed.
350    *    <br>Can contain normal or simplified JSON.
351    * @param p
352    *    The parser to use to parse the input.
353    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, uses {@link JsonParser}.
354    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
355    */
356   public JsonMap(Reader in, Parser p) throws ParseException {
357      this(p == null ? BeanContext.DEFAULT_SESSION : p.getBeanContext().getSession());
358      parse(in, p);
359   }
360
361   /**
362    * Construct a map initialized with the specified key/value pairs.
363    *
364    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
365    * <p class='bjava'>
366    *    JsonMap <jv>map</jv> = <jk>new</jk> JsonMap(<js>"key1"</js>,<js>"val1"</js>,<js>"key2"</js>,<js>"val2"</js>);
367    * </p>
368    *
369    * @param keyValuePairs A list of key/value pairs to add to this map.
370    */
371   public JsonMap(Object... keyValuePairs) {
372      if (keyValuePairs.length % 2 != 0)
373         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Odd number of parameters passed into JsonMap(Object...)");
374      for (int i = 0; i < keyValuePairs.length; i+=2)
375         put(Utils.s(keyValuePairs[i]), keyValuePairs[i+1]);
376   }
377
378   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
379   // Initializers
380   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
381
382   /**
383    * Set an inner map in this map to allow for chained get calls.
384    *
385    * <p>
386    * If {@link #get(Object)} returns <jk>null</jk>, then {@link #get(Object)} will be called on the inner map.
387    *
388    * <p>
389    * In addition to providing the ability to chain maps, this method also provides the ability to wrap an existing map
390    * inside another map so that you can add entries to the outer map without affecting the values on the inner map.
391    *
392    * <p class='bjava'>
393    *    JsonMap <jv>map1</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>ofJson</jsm>(<js>"{foo:1}"</js>);
394    *    JsonMap <jv>map2</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>().setInner(<jv>map1</jv>);
395    *    <jv>map2</jv>.put(<js>"foo"</js>, 2);                      <jc>// Overwrite the entry</jc>
396    *    <jk>int</jk> <jv>foo1</jv> = <jv>map1</jv>.getInt(<js>"foo"</js>);           <jc>// foo1 == 1 </jc>
397    *    <jk>int</jk> <jv>foo2</jv> = <jv>map2</jv>.getInt(<js>"foo"</js>);           <jc>// foo2 == 2 </jc>
398    * </p>
399    *
400    * @param inner
401    *    The inner map.
402    *    Can be <jk>null</jk> to remove the inner map from an existing map.
403    * @return This object.
404    */
405   public JsonMap inner(Map<String,Object> inner) {
406      this.inner = inner;
407      return this;
408   }
409
410   /**
411    * Override the default bean session used for converting POJOs.
412    *
413    * <p>
414    * Default is {@link BeanContext#DEFAULT}, which is sufficient in most cases.
415    *
416    * <p>
417    * Useful if you're serializing/parsing beans with transforms defined.
418    *
419    * @param session The new bean session.
420    * @return This object.
421    */
422   public JsonMap session(BeanSession session) {
423      this.session = session;
424      return this;
425   }
426
427   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
428   // Appenders
429   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
430
431   /**
432    * Adds an entry to this map.
433    *
434    * @param key The key.
435    * @param value The value.
436    * @return This object.
437    */
438   public JsonMap append(String key, Object value) {
439      put(key, value);
440      return this;
441   }
442
443   /**
444    * Appends all the entries in the specified map to this map.
445    *
446    * @param values The map to copy.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
447    * @return This object.
448    */
449   public JsonMap append(Map<String,Object> values) {
450      if (values != null)
451         super.putAll(values);
452      return this;
453   }
454
455   /**
456    * Add if flag is <jk>true</jk>.
457    *
458    * @param flag The flag to check.
459    * @param key The key.
460    * @param value The value.
461    * @return This object.
462    */
463   public JsonMap appendIf(boolean flag, String key, Object value) {
464      if (flag)
465         append(key, value);
466      return this;
467   }
468
469   /**
470    * Add if predicate matches value.
471    *
472    * @param <T> The value type.
473    * @param test The predicate to match against.
474    * @param key The key.
475    * @param value The value.
476    * @return This object.
477    */
478   public <T> JsonMap appendIf(Predicate<T> test, String key, T value) {
479      return appendIf(test(test, value), key, value);
480   }
481
482   /**
483    * Adds the first value that matches the specified predicate.
484    *
485    * @param <T> The value types.
486    * @param test The predicate to match against.
487    * @param key The key.
488    * @param values The values to test.
489    * @return This object.
490    */
491   @SafeVarargs
492   public final <T> JsonMap appendFirst(Predicate<T> test, String key, T...values) {
493      for (T v : values)
494         if (test(test, v))
495            return append(key, v);
496      return this;
497   }
498
499   /**
500    * Adds a value in this map if the entry does not exist or the current value is <jk>null</jk>.
501    *
502    * @param key The map key.
503    * @param value The value to set if the current value does not exist or is <jk>null</jk>.
504    * @return This object.
505    */
506   public JsonMap appendIfAbsent(String key, Object value) {
507      return appendIfAbsentIf(x -> true, key, value);
508   }
509
510   /**
511    * Adds a value in this map if the entry does not exist or the current value is <jk>null</jk> and the value matches the specified predicate.
512    *
513    * @param <T> The value type.
514    * @param predicate The predicate to test the value with.
515    * @param key The map key.
516    * @param value The value to set if the current value does not exist or is <jk>null</jk>.
517    * @return This object.
518    */
519   public <T> JsonMap appendIfAbsentIf(Predicate<T> predicate, String key, T value) {
520      Object o = get(key);
521      if (o == null && predicate.test(value))
522         put(key, value);
523      return this;
524   }
525
526   /**
527    * Enables filtering based on default values.
528    *
529    * <p>
530    * Any of the following types will be ignored when set as values in this map:
531    * <ul>
532    *    <li><jk>null</jk>
533    *    <li><jk>false</jk>
534    *    <li><c>-1</c> (any Number type)
535    *    <li>Empty arrays/collections/maps.
536    * </ul>
537    * @return This object.
538    */
539   public JsonMap filtered() {
540      return filtered(x -> ! (
541         x == null
542         || (x instanceof Boolean && x.equals(false))
543         || (x instanceof Number && ((Number)x).intValue() == -1)
544         || (isArray(x) && Array.getLength(x) == 0)
545         || (x instanceof Map && ((Map<?,?>)x).isEmpty())
546         || (x instanceof Collection && ((Collection<?>)x).isEmpty())
547      ));
548   }
549
550   /**
551    * Enables filtering based on a predicate test.
552    *
553    * <p>
554    * If the predicate evaluates to <jk>false</jk> on values added to this map, the entry will be skipped.
555    *
556    * @param value The value tester predicate.
557    * @return This object.
558    */
559   public JsonMap filtered(Predicate<Object> value) {
560      valueFilter = value;
561      return this;
562   }
563
564   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
565   // Retrievers
566   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
567
568   /**
569    * Same as {@link Map#get(Object) get()}, but casts or converts the value to the specified class type.
570    *
571    * <p>
572    * This is the preferred get method for simple types.
573    *
574    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
575    * <p class='bjava'>
576    *    JsonMap <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>ofJson</jsm>(<js>"..."</js>);
577    *
578    *    <jc>// Value converted to a string.</jc>
579    *    String <jv>string</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.get(<js>"key1"</js>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
580    *
581    *    <jc>// Value converted to a bean.</jc>
582    *    MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.get(<js>"key2"</js>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
583    *
584    *    <jc>// Value converted to a bean array.</jc>
585    *    MyBean[] <jv>beanArray</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.get(<js>"key3"</js>, MyBean[].<jk>class</jk>);
586    *
587    *    <jc>// Value converted to a linked-list of objects.</jc>
588    *    List <jv>list</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.get(<js>"key4"</js>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>);
589    *
590    *    <jc>// Value converted to a map of object keys/values.</jc>
591    *    Map <jv>map2</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.get(<js>"key5"</js>, TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>);
592    * </p>
593    *
594    * <p>
595    * See {@link BeanSession#convertToType(Object, ClassMeta)} for the list of valid data conversions.
596    *
597    * @param key The key.
598    * @param <T> The class type returned.
599    * @param type The class type returned.
600    * @return The value, or <jk>null</jk> if the entry doesn't exist.
601    */
602   public <T> T get(String key, Class<T> type) {
603      return getWithDefault(key, (T)null, type);
604   }
605
606   /**
607    * Same as {@link #get(String,Class)}, but allows for complex data types consisting of collections or maps.
608    *
609    * <p>
610    * The type can be a simple type (e.g. beans, strings, numbers) or parameterized type (collections/maps).
611    *
612    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
613    * <p class='bjava'>
614    *    JsonMap <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>ofJson</jsm>(<js>"..."</js>);
615    *
616    *    <jc>// Value converted to a linked-list of strings.</jc>
617    *    List&lt;String&gt; <jv>list1</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.get(<js>"key1"</js>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
618    *
619    *    <jc>// Value converted to a linked-list of beans.</jc>
620    *    List&lt;MyBean&gt; <jv>list2</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.get(<js>"key2"</js>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
621    *
622    *    <jc>// Value converted to a linked-list of linked-lists of strings.</jc>
623    *    List&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>list3</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.get(<js>"key3"</js>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
624    *
625    *    <jc>// Value converted to a map of string keys/values.</jc>
626    *    Map&lt;String,String&gt; <jv>map1</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.get(<js>"key4"</js>, TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
627    *
628    *    <jc>// Value converted to a map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans.</jc>
629    *    Map&lt;String,List&lt;MyBean&gt;&gt; <jv>map2</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.get(<js>"key5"</js>, TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, List.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
630    * </p>
631    *
632    * <p>
633    * <c>Collection</c> classes are assumed to be followed by zero or one objects indicating the element type.
634    *
635    * <p>
636    * <c>Map</c> classes are assumed to be followed by zero or two meta objects indicating the key and value types.
637    *
638    * <p>
639    * The array can be arbitrarily long to indicate arbitrarily complex data structures.
640    *
641    * <p>
642    * See {@link BeanSession#convertToType(Object, ClassMeta)} for the list of valid data conversions.
643    *
644    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
645    *    <li class='note'>
646    *       Use the {@link #get(String, Class)} method instead if you don't need a parameterized map/collection.
647    * </ul>
648    *
649    * @param key The key.
650    * @param <T> The class type returned.
651    * @param type The class type returned.
652    * @param args The class type parameters.
653    * @return The value, or <jk>null</jk> if the entry doesn't exist.
654    */
655   public <T> T get(String key, Type type, Type...args) {
656      return getWithDefault(key, null, type, args);
657   }
658
659   /**
660    * Same as {@link Map#get(Object) get()}, but returns the default value if the key could not be found.
661    *
662    * @param key The key.
663    * @param def The default value if the entry doesn't exist.
664    * @return The value, or the default value if the entry doesn't exist.
665    */
666   public Object getWithDefault(String key, Object def) {
667      Object o = get(key);
668      return (o == null ? def : o);
669   }
670
671   /**
672    * Same as {@link #get(String,Class)} but returns a default value if the value does not exist.
673    *
674    * @param key The key.
675    * @param def The default value.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
676    * @param <T> The class type returned.
677    * @param type The class type returned.
678    * @return The value, or <jk>null</jk> if the entry doesn't exist.
679    */
680   public <T> T getWithDefault(String key, T def, Class<T> type) {
681      return getWithDefault(key, def, type, new Type[0]);
682   }
683
684   /**
685    * Same as {@link #get(String,Type,Type...)} but returns a default value if the value does not exist.
686    *
687    * @param key The key.
688    * @param def The default value.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
689    * @param <T> The class type returned.
690    * @param type The class type returned.
691    * @param args The class type parameters.
692    * @return The value, or <jk>null</jk> if the entry doesn't exist.
693    */
694   public <T> T getWithDefault(String key, T def, Type type, Type...args) {
695      Object o = get(key);
696      if (o == null)
697         return def;
698      T t = bs().convertToType(o, type, args);
699      return t == null ? def : t;
700   }
701
702   /**
703    * Searches for the specified key in this map ignoring case.
704    *
705    * @param key
706    *    The key to search for.
707    *    For performance reasons, it's preferable that the key be all lowercase.
708    * @return The key, or <jk>null</jk> if map does not contain this key.
709    */
710   public String findKeyIgnoreCase(String key) {
711      for (String k : keySet())
712         if (key.equalsIgnoreCase(k))
713            return k;
714      return null;
715   }
716
717   /**
718    * Same as {@link Map#get(Object) get()}, but converts the raw value to the specified class type using the specified
719    * POJO swap.
720    *
721    * @param key The key.
722    * @param objectSwap The swap class used to convert the raw type to a transformed type.
723    * @param <T> The transformed class type.
724    * @return The value, or <jk>null</jk> if the entry doesn't exist.
725    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
726    */
727   @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
728   public <T> T getSwapped(String key, ObjectSwap<T,?> objectSwap) throws ParseException {
729      try {
730         Object o = super.get(key);
731         if (o == null)
732            return null;
733         ObjectSwap swap = objectSwap;
734         return (T) swap.unswap(bs(), o, null);
735      } catch (ParseException e) {
736         throw e;
737      } catch (Exception e) {
738         throw new ParseException(e);
739      }
740   }
741
742   /**
743    * Returns the value for the first key in the list that has an entry in this map.
744    *
745    * @param keys The keys to look up in order.
746    * @return The value of the first entry whose key exists, or <jk>null</jk> if none of the keys exist in this map.
747    */
748   public Object find(String...keys) {
749      for (String key : keys)
750         if (containsKey(key))
751            return get(key);
752      return null;
753   }
754
755   /**
756    * Returns the value for the first key in the list that has an entry in this map.
757    *
758    * <p>
759    * Casts or converts the value to the specified class type.
760    *
761    * <p>
762    * See {@link BeanSession#convertToType(Object, ClassMeta)} for the list of valid data conversions.
763    *
764    * @param type The class type to convert the value to.
765    * @param <T> The class type to convert the value to.
766    * @param keys The keys to look up in order.
767    * @return The value of the first entry whose key exists, or <jk>null</jk> if none of the keys exist in this map.
768    */
769   public <T> T find(Class<T> type, String...keys) {
770      for (String key : keys)
771         if (containsKey(key))
772            return get(key, type);
773      return null;
774   }
775
776   /**
777    * Returns the specified entry value converted to a {@link String}.
778    *
779    * <p>
780    * Shortcut for <code>get(key, String.<jk>class</jk>)</code>.
781    *
782    * @param key The key.
783    * @return The converted value, or <jk>null</jk> if the map contains no mapping for this key.
784    */
785   public String getString(String key) {
786      return get(key, String.class);
787   }
788
789   /**
790    * Returns the specified entry value converted to a {@link String}.
791    *
792    * <p>
793    * Shortcut for <code>get(key, String[].<jk>class</jk>)</code>.
794    *
795    * @param key The key.
796    * @return The converted value, or <jk>null</jk> if the map contains no mapping for this key.
797    */
798   public String[] getStringArray(String key) {
799      return getStringArray(key, null);
800   }
801
802   /**
803    * Same as {@link #getStringArray(String)} but returns a default value if the value cannot be found.
804    *
805    * @param key The map key.
806    * @param def The default value if value is not found.
807    * @return The value converted to a string array.
808    */
809   public String[] getStringArray(String key, String[] def) {
810      Object s = get(key, Object.class);
811      if (s == null)
812         return def;
813      String[] r = null;
814      if (s instanceof Collection)
815         r = ArrayUtils.toStringArray((Collection<?>)s);
816      else if (s instanceof String[])
817         r = (String[])s;
818      else if (s instanceof Object[])
819         r = ArrayUtils.toStringArray(alist((Object[])s));
820      else
821         r = splita(Utils.s(s));
822      return (r.length == 0 ? def : r);
823   }
824

826    * Returns the specified entry value converted to a {@link String}.

828    * <p>
829    * Shortcut for <code>getWithDefault(key, defVal, String.<jk>class</jk>)</code>.
830    *
831    * @param key The key.
832    * @param defVal The default value if the map doesn't contain the specified mapping.
833    * @return The converted value, or the default value if the map contains no mapping for this key.
834    */
835   public String getString(String key, String defVal) {
836      return getWithDefault(key, defVal, String.class);
837   }

943    * <p>

945    *

955   /**
956    * Same as {@link #getMap(String)} but creates a new empty {@link JsonMap} if it doesn't already exist.
957    *
958    * @param key The key.
959    * @param createIfNotExists If mapping doesn't already exist, create one with an empty {@link JsonMap}.
960    * @return The converted value, or an empty value if the map contains no mapping for this key.
961    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
962    */
963   public JsonMap getMap(String key, boolean createIfNotExists) {
964      JsonMap m = getWithDefault(key, null, JsonMap.class);
965      if (m == null && createIfNotExists) {
966         m = new JsonMap();
967         put(key, m);
968      }
969      return m;
970   }

972   /**
973    * Same as {@link #getMap(String, JsonMap)} except converts the keys and values to the specified types.
974    *
975    * @param <K> The key type.
976    * @param <V> The value type.
977    * @param key The key.
978    * @param keyType The key type class.
979    * @param valType The value type class.
980    * @param def The default value if the map doesn't contain the specified mapping.
981    * @return The converted value, or the default value if the map contains no mapping for this key.
982    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
983    */
984   public <K,V> Map<K,V> getMap(String key, Class<K> keyType, Class<V> valType, Map<K,V> def) {
985      Object o = get(key);
986      if (o == null)
987         return def;
988      return bs().convertToType(o, Map.class, keyType, valType);
989   }

1169   /**
1170    * Equivalent to calling <c>get(class,key,def)</c> followed by <c>remove(key);</c>
1171    * @param key The key.
1172    * @param defVal The default value if the map doesn't contain the specified mapping.
1173    * @param type The class type.
1174    *
1175    * @param <T> The class type.
1176    * @return The converted value, or the default value if the map contains no mapping for this key.
1177    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
1178    */
1179   public <T> T removeWithDefault(String key, T defVal, Class<T> type) {
1180      T t = getWithDefault(key, defVal, type);
1181      remove(key);
1182      return t;
1183   }
1184
1185   /**
1186    * Equivalent to calling <code>removeWithDefault(key,<jk>null</jk>,String.<jk>class</jk>)</code>.
1187    *
1188    * @param key The key.
1189    * @return The converted value, or <jk>null</jk> if the map contains no mapping for this key.
1190    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
1191    */
1192   public String removeString(String key) {
1193      return removeString(key, null);
1194   }
1195
1196   /**
1197    * Equivalent to calling <code>removeWithDefault(key,def,String.<jk>class</jk>)</code>.
1198    *
1199    * @param key The key.
1200    * @param def The default value if the map doesn't contain the specified mapping.
1201    * @return The converted value, or the default value if the map contains no mapping for this key.
1202    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
1203    */
1204   public String removeString(String key, String def) {
1205      return removeWithDefault(key, def, String.class);
1206   }
1207
1208   /**
1209    * Equivalent to calling <code>removeWithDefault(key,<jk>null</jk>,Integer.<jk>class</jk>)</code>.
1210    *
1211    * @param key The key.
1212    * @return The converted value, or <jk>null</jk> if the map contains no mapping for this key.
1213    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
1214    */
1215   public Integer removeInt(String key) {
1216      return removeInt(key, null);
1217   }
1218
1219   /**
1220    * Equivalent to calling <code>removeWithDefault(key,def,Integer.<jk>class</jk>)</code>.
1221    *
1222    * @param key The key.
1223    * @param def The default value if the map doesn't contain the specified mapping.
1224    * @return The converted value, or the default value if the map contains no mapping for this key.
1225    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
1226    */
1227   public Integer removeInt(String key, Integer def) {
1228      return removeWithDefault(key, def, Integer.class);
1229   }
1230
1231   /**
1232    * Equivalent to calling <code>removeWithDefault(key,<jk>null</jk>,Boolean.<jk>class</jk>)</code>.
1233    *
1234    * @param key The key.
1235    * @return The converted value, or <jk>null</jk> if the map contains no mapping for this key.
1236    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
1237    */
1238   public Boolean removeBoolean(String key) {
1239      return removeBoolean(key, null);
1240   }
1241
1242   /**
1243    * Equivalent to calling <code>removeWithDefault(key,def,Boolean.<jk>class</jk>)</code>.
1244    *
1245    * @param key The key.
1246    * @param def The default value if the map doesn't contain the specified mapping.
1247    * @return The converted value, or the default value if the map contains no mapping for this key.
1248    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
1249    */
1250   public Boolean removeBoolean(String key, Boolean def) {
1251      return removeWithDefault(key, def, Boolean.class);
1252   }
1253
1254   /**
1255    * Convenience method for removing several keys at once.
1256    *
1257    * @param keys The list of keys to remove.
1258    */
1259   public void removeAll(Collection<String> keys) {
1260      keys.forEach(this::remove);
1261   }
1262
1263   /**
1264    * Convenience method for removing several keys at once.
1265    *
1266    * @param keys The list of keys to remove.
1267    */
1268   public void removeAll(String... keys) {
1269      for (String k : keys)
1270         remove(k);
1271   }
1272
1273   /**
1274    * The opposite of {@link #removeAll(String...)}.
1275    *
1276    * <p>
1277    * Discards all keys from this map that aren't in the specified list.
1278    *
1279    * @param keys The keys to keep.
1280    * @return This map.
1281    */
1282   public JsonMap keepAll(String...keys) {
1283      for (Iterator<String> i = keySet().iterator(); i.hasNext();) {
1284         boolean remove = true;
1285         String key = i.next();
1286         for (String k : keys) {
1287            if (k.equals(key)) {
1288               remove = false;
1289               break;
1290            }
1291         }
1292         if (remove)
1293            i.remove();
1294      }
1295      return this;
1296   }
1297
1298   /**
1299    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the map contains the specified entry and the value is not null nor an empty string.
1300    *
1301    * <p>
1302    * Always returns <jk>false</jk> if the value is not a {@link CharSequence}.
1303    *
1304    * @param key The key.
1305    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the map contains the specified entry and the value is not null nor an empty string.
1306    */
1307   public boolean containsKeyNotEmpty(String key) {
1308      Object val = get(key);
1309      if (val == null)
1310         return false;
1311      if (val instanceof CharSequence)
1312         return ! Utils.isEmpty((CharSequence)val);
1313      return false;
1314   }
1315
1316   /**
1317    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this map contains the specified key, ignoring the inner map if it exists.
1318    *
1319    * @param key The key to look up.
1320    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this map contains the specified key.
1321    */
1322   public boolean containsOuterKey(Object key) {
1323      return super.containsKey(key);
1324   }
1325
1326   /**
1327    * Returns a copy of this <c>JsonMap</c> with only the specified keys.
1328    *
1329    * @param keys The keys of the entries to copy.
1330    * @return A new map with just the keys and values from this map.
1331    */
1332   public JsonMap include(String...keys) {
1333      JsonMap m2 = new JsonMap();
1334      this.forEach((k,v) -> {
1335         for (String kk : keys)
1336            if (kk.equals(k))
1337               m2.put(kk, v);
1338      });
1339      return m2;
1340   }
1341
1342   /**
1343    * Returns a copy of this <c>JsonMap</c> without the specified keys.
1344    *
1345    * @param keys The keys of the entries not to copy.
1346    * @return A new map without the keys and values from this map.
1347    */
1348   public JsonMap exclude(String...keys) {
1349      JsonMap m2 = new JsonMap();
1350      this.forEach((k,v) -> {
1351         boolean exclude = false;
1352         for (String kk : keys)
1353            if (kk.equals(k))
1354               exclude = true;
1355         if (! exclude)
1356            m2.put(k, v);
1357      });
1358      return m2;
1359   }
1360
1361   /**
1362    * Converts this map into an object of the specified type.
1363    *
1364    * <p>
1365    * If this map contains a <js>"_type"</js> entry, it must be the same as or a subclass of the <c>type</c>.
1366    *
1367    * @param <T> The class type to convert this map object to.
1368    * @param type The class type to convert this map object to.
1369    * @return The new object.
1370    * @throws ClassCastException
1371    *    If the <js>"_type"</js> entry is present and not assignable from <c>type</c>
1372    */
1373   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1374   public <T> T cast(Class<T> type) {
1375      BeanSession bs = bs();
1376      ClassMeta<?> c2 = bs.getClassMeta(type);
1377      String typePropertyName = bs.getBeanTypePropertyName(c2);
1378      ClassMeta<?> c1 = bs.getBeanRegistry().getClassMeta((String)get(typePropertyName));
1379      ClassMeta<?> c = c1 == null ? c2 : narrowClassMeta(c1, c2);
1380      if (c.isObject())
1381         return (T)this;
1382      return (T)cast2(c);
1383   }
1384
1385   /**
1386    * Same as {@link #cast(Class)}, except allows you to specify a {@link ClassMeta} parameter.
1387    *
1388    * @param <T> The class type to convert this map object to.
1389    * @param cm The class type to convert this map object to.
1390    * @return The new object.
1391    * @throws ClassCastException
1392    *    If the <js>"_type"</js> entry is present and not assignable from <c>type</c>
1393    */
1394   @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked"})
1395   public <T> T cast(ClassMeta<T> cm) {
1396      BeanSession bs = bs();
1397      ClassMeta<?> c1 = bs.getBeanRegistry().getClassMeta((String)get(bs.getBeanTypePropertyName(cm)));
1398      ClassMeta<?> c = narrowClassMeta(c1, cm);
1399      return (T)cast2(c);
1400   }

1406   /**
1407    * Same as {@link #get(String,Class) get(String,Class)}, but the key is a slash-delimited path used to traverse
1408    * entries in this POJO.
1409    *
1410    * <p>
1411    * For example, the following code is equivalent:
1412    * </p>
1413    * <p class='bjava'>
1414    *    JsonMap <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>ofJson</jsm>(<js>"..."</js>);
1415    *
1416    *    <jc>// Long way</jc>
1417    *    <jk>long</jk> <jv>_long</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.getMap(<js>"foo"</js>).getList(<js>"bar"</js>).getMap(<js>"0"</js>).getLong(<js>"baz"</js>);
1418    *
1419    *    <jc>// Using this method</jc>
1420    *    <jk>long</jk> <jv>_long</jv> = <jv>map</jv>.getAt(<js>"foo/bar/0/baz"</js>, <jk>long</jk>.<jk>class</jk>);
1421    * </p>
1422    *
1423    * <p>
1424    * This method uses the {@link ObjectRest} class to perform the lookup, so the map can contain any of the various
1425    * class types that the {@link ObjectRest} class supports (e.g. beans, collections, arrays).
1426    *
1427    * @param path The path to the entry.
1428    * @param type The class type.
1429    *
1430    * @param <T> The class type.
1431    * @return The value, or <jk>null</jk> if the entry doesn't exist.
1432    */
1433   public <T> T getAt(String path, Class<T> type) {
1434      return getObjectRest().get(path, type);
1435   }
1436
1437   /**
1438    * Same as {@link #getAt(String,Class)}, but allows for conversion to complex maps and collections.
1439    *
1440    * <p>
1441    * This method uses the {@link ObjectRest} class to perform the lookup, so the map can contain any of the various
1442    * class types that the {@link ObjectRest} class supports (e.g. beans, collections, arrays).
1443    *
1444    * @param path The path to the entry.
1445    * @param type The class type.
1446    * @param args The class parameter types.
1447    *
1448    * @param <T> The class type.
1449    * @return The value, or <jk>null</jk> if the entry doesn't exist.
1450    */
1451   public <T> T getAt(String path, Type type, Type...args) {
1452      return getObjectRest().get(path, type, args);
1453   }

1455   /**
1456    * Same as <c>put(String,Object)</c>, but the key is a slash-delimited path used to traverse entries in this
1457    * POJO.
1458    *
1459    * <p>
1460    * For example, the following code is equivalent:
1461    * </p>
1462    * <p class='bjava'>
1463    *    JsonMap <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>ofJson</jsm>(<js>"..."</js>);
1464    *
1465    *    <jc>// Long way</jc>
1466    *    <jv>map</jv>.getMap(<js>"foo"</js>).getList(<js>"bar"</js>).getMap(<js>"0"</js>).put(<js>"baz"</js>, 123);
1467    *
1468    *    <jc>// Using this method</jc>
1469    *    <jv>map</jv>.putAt(<js>"foo/bar/0/baz"</js>, 123);
1470    * </p>
1471    *
1472    * <p>
1473    * This method uses the {@link ObjectRest} class to perform the lookup, so the map can contain any of the various
1474    * class types that the {@link ObjectRest} class supports (e.g. beans, collections, arrays).
1475    *
1476    * @param path The path to the entry.
1477    * @param o The new value.
1478    * @return The previous value, or <jk>null</jk> if the entry doesn't exist.
1479    */
1480   public Object putAt(String path, Object o) {
1481      return getObjectRest().put(path, o);
1482   }

1486    *

1490    * <p class='bjava'>

1508   public Object postAt(String path, Object o) {

1518    * </p>
1519    * <p class='bjava'>

1532    *
1533    * @param path The path to the entry.
1534    * @return The previous value, or <jk>null</jk> if the entry doesn't exist.
1535    */
1536   public Object deleteAt(String path) {
1537      return getObjectRest().delete(path);
1538   }

1547         super.put(key, value);
1548      return null;

1571   /**
1572    * Convenience method for inserting JSON directly into an attribute on this object.

1575    * The JSON text can be an object (i.e. <js>"{...}"</js>) or an array (i.e. <js>"[...]"</js>).
1576    *

1578    * @param json The JSON text that will be parsed into an Object and then inserted into this map.
1579    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
1580    */
1581   public void putJson(String key, String json) throws ParseException {
1582      this.put(key, JsonParser.DEFAULT.parse(json, Object.class));

1602         return Utils.s(this);

1637      return false;
1638   }

1640   /**
1641    * Returns a modifiable copy of this map if it's unmodifiable.
1642    *
1643    * @return A modifiable copy of this map if it's unmodifiable, or this map if it is already modifiable.
1644    */
1645   public JsonMap modifiable() {
1646      if (isUnmodifiable())
1647         return new JsonMap(this);
1648      return this;
1649   }

1651   /**
1652    * Returns an unmodifiable copy of this map if it's modifiable.
1653    *
1654    * @return An unmodifiable copy of this map if it's modifiable, or this map if it is already unmodifiable.
1655    */
1656   public JsonMap unmodifiable() {
1657      if (this instanceof UnmodifiableJsonMap)
1658         return this;
1659      return new UnmodifiableJsonMap(this);
1660   }

1662   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1663   // Utility methods
1664   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1665
1666   private BeanSession bs() {
1667      if (session == null)
1668         session = BeanContext.DEFAULT_SESSION;
1669      return session;
1670   }
1671
1672   private ObjectRest getObjectRest() {
1673      if (objectRest == null)
1674         objectRest = new ObjectRest(this);
1675      return objectRest;
1676   }
1677
1678   /*
1679    * Combines the class specified by a "_type" attribute with the ClassMeta
1680    * passed in through the cast(ClassMeta) method.
1681    * The rule is that child classes supersede parent classes, and c2 supersedes c1
1682    * if one isn't the parent of another.
1683    */
1684   private ClassMeta<?> narrowClassMeta(ClassMeta<?> c1, ClassMeta<?> c2) {
1685      if (c1 == null)
1686         return c2;
1687      ClassMeta<?> c = getNarrowedClassMeta(c1, c2);
1688      if (c1.isMap()) {
1689         ClassMeta<?> k = getNarrowedClassMeta(c1.getKeyType(), c2.getKeyType());
1690         ClassMeta<?> v = getNarrowedClassMeta(c1.getValueType(), c2.getValueType());
1691         return bs().getClassMeta(c.getInnerClass(), k, v);
1692      }
1693      if (c1.isCollection()) {
1694         ClassMeta<?> e = getNarrowedClassMeta(c1.getElementType(), c2.getElementType());
1695         return bs().getClassMeta(c.getInnerClass(), e);
1696      }
1697      return c;
1698   }
1699
1700   /*
1701    * If c1 is a child of c2 or the same as c2, returns c1.
1702    * Otherwise, returns c2.
1703    */
1704   private static ClassMeta<?> getNarrowedClassMeta(ClassMeta<?> c1, ClassMeta<?> c2) {
1705      if (c2 == null || c2.getInfo().isParentOf(c1.getInnerClass()))
1706         return c1;
1707      return c2;
1708   }
1709
1710   /*
1711    * Converts this map to the specified class type.
1712    */
1713   @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked","rawtypes"})
1714   private <T> T cast2(ClassMeta<T> cm) {
1715
1716      BeanSession bs = bs();
1717      try {
1718         Object value = get("value");
1719
1720         if (cm.isMap()) {
1721            Map m2 = (cm.canCreateNewInstance() ? (Map)cm.newInstance() : new JsonMap(bs));
1722            ClassMeta<?> kType = cm.getKeyType(), vType = cm.getValueType();
1723            forEach((k,v) -> {
1724               if (! k.equals(bs.getBeanTypePropertyName(cm))) {
1725
1726                  // Attempt to recursively cast child maps.
1727                  if (v instanceof JsonMap)
1728                     v = ((JsonMap)v).cast(vType);
1729
1730                  Object k2 = (kType.isString() ? k : bs.convertToType(k, kType));
1731                  v = (vType.isObject() ? v : bs.convertToType(v, vType));
1732
1733                  m2.put(k2, v);
1734               }
1735            });
1736            return (T)m2;
1737
1738         } else if (cm.isBean()) {
1739            BeanMap<? extends T> bm = bs.newBeanMap(cm.getInnerClass());
1740
1741            // Iterate through all the entries in the map and set the individual field values.
1742            forEach((k,v) -> {
1743               if (! k.equals(bs.getBeanTypePropertyName(cm))) {
1744
1745                  // Attempt to recursively cast child maps.
1746                  if (v instanceof JsonMap)
1747                     v = ((JsonMap)v).cast(bm.getProperty(k).getMeta().getClassMeta());
1748
1749                  bm.put(k, v);
1750               }
1751            });
1752
1753            return bm.getBean();
1754
1755         } else if (cm.isCollectionOrArray()) {
1756            List items = (List)get("items");
1757            return bs.convertToType(items, cm);
1758
1759         } else if (value != null) {
1760            return bs.convertToType(value, cm);
1761         }
1762
1763      } catch (Exception e) {
1764         throw new BeanRuntimeException(e, cm.getInnerClass(),
1765            "Error occurred attempting to cast to an object of type ''{0}''", cm.getInnerClass().getName());
1766      }
1767
1768      throw new BeanRuntimeException(cm.getInnerClass(),
1769         "Cannot convert to class type ''{0}''.  Only beans and maps can be converted using this method.",
1770         cm.getInnerClass().getName());
1771   }
1772
1773   private void parse(Reader r, Parser p) throws ParseException {
1774      if (p == null)
1775         p = JsonParser.DEFAULT;
1776      p.parseIntoMap(r, this, bs().string(), bs().object());
1777   }
1778
1779   private static class UnmodifiableJsonMap extends JsonMap {
1780      private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1781
1782      @SuppressWarnings("synthetic-access")
1783      UnmodifiableJsonMap(JsonMap contents) {
1784         if (contents != null)
1785            contents.forEach(super::put);
1786      }
1787
1788      @Override
1789      public Object put(String key, Object val) {
1790         throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Not supported on read-only object.");
1791      }
1792
1793      @Override
1794      public Object remove(Object key) {
1795         throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Not supported on read-only object.");
1796      }
1797
1798      @Override
1799      public boolean isUnmodifiable() {
1800         return true;
1801      }
1802   }
1803
1804   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1805   // Overridden methods.
1806   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1807
1808   @Override /* Map */
1809   public Object get(Object key) {
1810      Object o = super.get(key);
1811      if (o == null && inner != null)
1812         o = inner.get(key);
1813      return o;
1814   }
1815
1816   @Override /* Map */
1817   public boolean containsKey(Object key) {
1818      if (super.containsKey(key))
1819         return true;
1820      if (inner != null)
1821         return inner.containsKey(key);
1822      return false;
1823   }
1824
1825   @Override /* Map */
1826   public Set<String> keySet() {
1827      if (inner == null)
1828         return super.keySet();
1829      LinkedHashSet<String> s = Utils.set();
1830      s.addAll(inner.keySet());
1831      s.addAll(super.keySet());
1832      return s;
1833   }
1834
1835   @Override /* Map */
1836   public Set<Map.Entry<String,Object>> entrySet() {
1837      if (inner == null)
1838         return super.entrySet();
1839
1840      final Set<String> keySet = keySet();
1841      final Iterator<String> keys = keySet.iterator();
1842
1843      return new AbstractSet<>() {
1844
1845         @Override /* Iterable */
1846         public Iterator<Map.Entry<String,Object>> iterator() {
1847
1848            return new Iterator<>() {
1849
1850               @Override /* Iterator */
1851               public boolean hasNext() {
1852                  return keys.hasNext();
1853               }
1854
1855               @Override /* Iterator */
1856               public Map.Entry<String,Object> next() {
1857                  return new Map.Entry<>() {
1858                     String key = keys.next();
1859
1860                     @Override /* Map.Entry */
1861                     public String getKey() {
1862                        return key;
1863                     }
1864
1865                     @Override /* Map.Entry */
1866                     public Object getValue() {
1867                        return get(key);
1868                     }
1869
1870                     @Override /* Map.Entry */
1871                     public Object setValue(Object object) {
1872                        return put(key, object);
1873                     }
1874                  };
1875               }
1876
1877               @Override /* Iterator */
1878               public void remove() {
1879                  throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Not supported on read-only object.");
1880               }
1881            };
1882         }
1883
1884         @Override /* Set */
1885         public int size() {
1886            return keySet.size();
1887         }
1888      };
1889   }
1890
1891   /**
1892    * A synonym for {@link #toString()}
1893    *
1894    * @return This object as a JSON string.
1895    */
1896   public String asJson() {
1897      return toString();
1898   }
1899
1900   @Override /* Object */
1901   public String toString() {
1902      return Json5.of(this);
1903   }
